issues.description: The declaration of fix_vec_cross in solution_repository/example_program/src/math_fix.h uses the wrong parameter type for the output vector (declares a single fix_t named 'o' instead of a pointer fix_t *o). The implementation (math_fix.c) and the template header expect a pointer (fix_t *o) and the assembler/test code call the function with a pointer. This mismatch will lead to compilation errors or incorrect linkage and will confuse students about the correct function signature to implement or call.
issues.suggested_fix: Fix the prototype in example_program/src/math_fix.h to match the implementation and template: change the declaration to use a pointer for the output vector, i.e. 'void fix_vec_cross(const fix_t *v1, const fix_t *v2, fix_t *o);'. Ensure all headers (template and solution) and any callers use the same signature.
